website_summaries.verdict: Worth a look if you want a down comforter that's fluffy yet lightweight enough to be used all year long.
pros: Filled with real down and goose feathers in a soft cotton cover
Owners brag about how it's warm without being extremely hot
cons: Down fill has the tendency to shift despite the baffle-box stitching

customer_reviews.title: just buy it
customer_reviews.text: OK, I've had this comforter for about six months. I've always purchased premium comforters, believing that a good night's sleep is worth the extra money. I've always headed to Macy's during a home sale, and picked one up there. This is the BEST comforter ever. Unfortunately, the last gf didn't work out so I'm sleeping alone. I sleep with the windows open, and the low temperatures here are generally around freezing (mid 20s at the lowest) during the Winter.... not super cold, but cold enough that previous comforters were sometimes barely adequate. This one keeps me toasty. And the look is somewhat elegant. If you like the price, you'll be happy... my guess.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Down ALL at the bottom of the comforter!
customer_reviews.text: The cotton shell is the best thing about this comforter. I chose this comforter because it had the quilted squares and a natural fiber shell. I was hoping that the quilted squares would help the down stay where it’s supposed to- thereby prolonging the life of my comforter. Well, I’ve got one year with this product and despite shaking it every single time I make the bed, all the down is in the bottom two quilted squares. As you can see in the picture. We tried to displace the down again tonight, and it’s pointless. I can’t shake it back into place. Bottom line, don’t waste your money. The comforter is a real bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Patience Vitacco

customer_reviews.title: I looked at many, this seems to be among the best
customer_reviews.text: Love this comforter. I have the King and Queen sizes and they're both great. Not too hot, not too cold, good weight for sleeping. All that's needed is a sheet and this blanket. Add a duvet and you're good to go. No complaints, has been holding up well after many months; no signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: but it seems to be a really nice comforter! Give it a little time to puff ...
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased one around $100 from costco, but the quality was disappointing. I returned it and bought this, and it's MUCH nicer. I was worried that the reviews were fake or something, but it seems to be a really nice comforter! Give it a little time to puff out after you unbox it! I would definitely recommend this comforter! It's a bargain. However, it is too warm to use in the summer/warm climates. I need a lighter one for that.
customer_reviews.author: Sorrel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Warm but not hot.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sleeping so much better now that I don't get cold in the night. As the reviews said, it is just a little bit noisy but I have a quilt over it and after I settle in for the night, I never hear it. Unless you are a very light sleeper, I can't imagine it would be a problem.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best comforter I have owned

customer_reviews.title: The cover is nice quality. I am concerned for 2 reasons
customer_reviews.text: I just received this comforter. The cover is nice quality. I am concerned for 2 reasons: the packaging says 100% down, but the tag on the actual comforter says minimum 75% down. Also, there is nowhere on either the packaging or the comforter itself that it says 600 fill power. It is pretty thin right out of the package, and without any markings indicating the fill power, I have my doubts that it is truly 600. I am considering returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza Belle

customer_reviews.title: DONT DO IT
customer_reviews.text: I've had this comforter for 3 years now and it has gotten thinner and thinner with each passing year. Every few weeks I have to turn the comforter because (what's left of the feathers) will bunch up at the bottom. The people who designed this comforter weren't thinking. They put 2 inch holes in each box so the feathers could move around. Why??? So half my comforter ends up with no feathers? It makes absolutely no sense. To say the least I fully regret this purchase. My comforter is basically a flat pancake at this point. I have already started looking into other brands. I will repost when I find something better (which shouldn't be too hard)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE OUR COMFORTERS!
customer_reviews.text: We've had our comforters for two years and love them! We leave them on all year round (Missouri). They are lightweight but very cozy. I always keep duvet covers on my comforters, so these still look like they are brand new. I fluff them when I change the sheets and they fluff right up. I don't know about the 100% goose down part, and really don't care, these comforters keeps us warm and toasty, and they look great!
customer_reviews.author: jodeg

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this comforter a little over a year ago to go inside a duvet cover. It's so warm and cozy! I absolutely love it! I sleep cold, and this keeps me nice and warm, eliminating the need for extra blankets. The weight is great, too! You feel tucked in but not weighed down. Love it so much I bought the same one for my daughter (just a different size) when she wanted a new comforter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hot sleepers
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wanted a down blanket for a long time, but I’m a very hot sleeper and didn’t want to buy one that would make me sweat all night. This one is perfect! Nicely fluffy to make the bed comfy, but not too hot at all, even with the use of a weighted blanket during hot California summer nights! This one has little fabric ties in the corners for duvet covers. Very happy.

product_meta.description:
Size:Full/Queen

 Benefits of Using Down Comforter 

Sleeping is the only time you allow yourself to get some rest. So why not get the most of out of it, right? 

The benefits you’ll enjoy once you start using a down comforter include 

Incomparable and longer warmth thanks to the blanket's ability to trap body heat within the filling. 

Comfort during the summer season thanks to its breathability, allowing sweat and moisture to pass through the filling. This prevents your body from overheating even if you are a warm sleeper 

High Quality Stuffing 

Our down and feather are selected and disinfected strictly. With its high fluffyness and softness, our product can significantly improve users' sleeping quality. 

Storage Method 

Many people store their comforters during off seasons. The key to storing your comforter is breathability. 

Letting the down breathe by keeping your comforter in a cloth bag will prevent any moisture or odor build up. 

It should also be stored in a location where it is not compressed and has room to stay fluffy. 

Give your comforter a good shake when you take it out of the bag next season and it should be ready to go

Package 

Down Comforter is vacuum packed during delivery. Please allow 24 hrs to recover its full loft. We recommend that you have your down comforter professionally dry cleaned
